clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Iron Deficiency Anemia on HBA1C in Patients With Diabetic Foot Ulcer Grade (1and2)
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Iron Deficiency Anemia on HBA1C in Patients With Diabetic Foot Ulcer Grade (1and2)

brief_summary.textblock: Diabetic foot ulcer is the commonest cause of severe limb ischemia in diabetes mellitus And development of anemia is an additional burden to the microvascular complications of diabetes

detailed_description.textblock: HBA1C is the predominant Hemoglobin found in HBA1 fraction and it constitutes 5% of total Hemoglobin in normal adults and up to 15%in patients with diabetes mellitus HBA1C is used to diagnose diabetes and to identify individuals that are at high risk for developing diabetes Iron deficiency anemia is one of the most prevalent form of malnutrition affect 1,62 billion people whish correspond to 24,8%of the world population Ferritin is the storage form of iron so it is found to be test for distinguishing those with iron deficiency anemia from those who are not iron deficient

primary_outcome.measure: Iron deficiency and HBA1C in diabetic patients
primary_outcome.description: The influence of iron deficiency anemia on HBA1C in diabetic patients

arm_group.description: 50 diabetic patients with diabetic foot ulcer grade (1and2) with iron deficiency anemia will be applied TO cbc ferritin HBA1C ankle brachial index by duplex

arm_group.arm_group_label: diabetic foot ulcer grade(1and2)without iron deficiency anemia
arm_group.description: 50 patients with diabetic foot ulcer grade (1and2) without iron deficiency anemia will be applied to CBC Ferritin, HBA1C ankle brachial index by duplex

intervention.description: Diabetic patients will be applied to CBC, HBA1C and serum ferritin
intervention.arm_group_label: diabetic foot ulcer grade(1and2)without iron deficiency anemia

study_pop.textblock: Diabetic patients with diabetic foot ulcer grade one and two with or without iron deficiency anemia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all diabetic patients with diabetic foot ulcer grade one and two above 18 year
Exclusion Criteria:
1. patients with anemia other than iron deficiency anemia
2. Patients on anticoagulants
3. patients with blood disease 4-patients below 18
